revised_title: Calculation of Optical Rotatory Power in Molecules with Four Refractive Radicals
tldr: The authors present a method to calculate the optical rotatory power of a molecule containing four refractive radicals arranged at the corners of an irregular tetrahedron. They explain how the rotatory power is determined by the arrangement and properties of the refractive centers in the molecule, and provide a formula to calculate it. This formula can be applied to various types of optically active compounds, but is only suitable for molecules with short, fairly simple radicals.
